nodes.bodyText: That's a breaking change. In order to make the task cacheable, I had to remove filePath from the generated files which means that it's better if identification is made based on name and packageName. If needed, we could add file.name (without path) but I don't think this would help much compared to qualified name.

nodes.bodyText: One main side effect of this pull request is that the IR class have been made Json serializable. I think that's ok but let me know if there's another way to look at this.

nodes.bodyText: Could you please elaborate more on this, why it's serializable?

nodes.bodyText:
That PR uses the IR  as task input/output so Gradle will need it be serialized for UP-TO-DATE checks.
The generateOperationIds tasks needs access to the sourceWithFragments and most of that is the result of parsing the .graphql files.
The other option if we want to avoid serialization is to keep everything bundled in one single task and keep relying on the OperationIdGenerator.version for invalidation, which feels less "Gradle-ly".
Something else to consider is multi-modules. I've been thinking about that lately and the IR would be a convenient point to inject fragments and types from another module.

nodes.bodyText:
As the Fragment and Operation IR classes contained absolute file paths, I had to duplicate the struct:

ParsedFragment is used during parsing and contains the absolute file path for diagnostics purposes
Fragment is serialized and later used by codegen. It contains package name and name but no absolute file path.

nodes.bodyText: Being able to use SDL in unit tests is lovely. Thanks @sav007 ! 🤗
Does this class actually need to be extended by users? Couldn't it work with just an interface containing generateOperationOutput, which gets invoked by a task managed by the Apollo plugin?

nodes.bodyText:
I thought you preferred defining your own Task. Having an interface, like OperationIdGenerator is of course doable too. It just feels a bit less "Gradle-y" because users will have to remember to bump operationIdGenerator.version every time the implementation changes.
With a user-defined task, Gradle will magically determine the classpath changed and invalidate as needed.
